 000010 00                          9033  1          =SEGFLG1    FLAG   ,                 State flags for processing rtn

+___    ______ ____    _____ _____  ____ __ ______    ______ _________
0                                   9718      81.     *
                                    9719      82.     * GETICAD -- Causes register r1 to be loaded with the effective
                                    9720      83.     *            address of an intercepeted instruction, (S, RS type
                                    9721      84.     *            instructions) or with 2 register numbers (for a
                                    9722      85.     *            RRE type instruction).
                                    9723      86.     *              These values are computed differently depending
                                    9724      87.     *            on whether the interception format 2 of the SIE
                                    9725      88.     *            instruction is installed.
                                    9726      89.     *              The values are obtained from IPB (POPs) which ORVYL
                                    9727      90.     *            calls ICAD1.
0                                   9729      92.              MACRO
                                    9730      93.     &L       GETICAD &R,&TYPE=
                                    9731      94.              AIF   ('&TYPE' EQ 'S').OK,('&TYPE' EQ 'RS').OK
                                    9732      95.              AIF   ('&TYPE' EQ 'RRE').OK
                                    9733      96.              MNOTE 8,'&TYPE is an invalid type for this macro.'
                                    9734      97.              MEXIT ,
                                    9735      98.     .OK      ANOP  ,
                                    9736      99.              IF    SIEICIF2,BEGIN          Interruption fmt 2 installed
                                    9737     100.              AIF   ('&TYPE' NE 'RRE').NOTRRE2
                                    9738     101.              LH    &R,SIEICAD1             RRE fmt 2
                                    9739     102.              AGO   .DON2
                                    9740     103.     .NOTRRE2 ANOP  ,                       S type for fmt 2
                                    9741     104.              LH    &R,SIEICAD1
                                    9742     105.              SLL   &R,16                   Clear high bits
                                    9743     106.              LR    EPAR,&R                 | load offset into reg
                                    9744     107.              SRL   &R,32-4                 | reg
                                    9745     108.              IF    (&R,NZ),BEGIN           Zero base
                                    9746     109.              LREGA &R,(&R)
                                    9747     110.              L     &R,0(,&R)
                                    9748     111.              END   ,                       OF Zero base
                                    9749     112.              SLL   EPAR,4                  | offset
                                    9750     113.              SRL   EPAR,32-12              |
                                    9751     114.              ALR   &R,EPAR
                                    9752     115.              AGO   .DON2
                                    9753     116.     .DON2    ANOP  ,
                                    9754     117.              END   ,                       OF Int fmt 2 installed
                                    9755     118.              ELSE  BEGIN                   Int fmt 2 NOT installed
                                    9756     119.              AIF   ('&TYPE' NE 'RRE').NOTRRE1
                                    9757     120.              L     &R,SIEICAD1             RRE fmt 1
                                    9758     121.              AGO   .DON1
                                    9759     122.     .NOTRRE1 ANOP  ,                       S type for fmt 1
                                    9760     123.              L     &R,SIEICAD1
                                    9761     124.              AGO   .DON1
                                    9762     125.     .DON1    ANOP  ,
                                    9763     126.              END   ,                       OF Int fmt 2 NOT installed
                                    9764     127.              MEND
                                    9765     128.     *
                                    9766     129.     * LREGA -- Causes register R1 to be loaded with the address of the
                                    9767     130.     *          guest register R2.  R2 may be contained in a Register
                                    9768     131.     *          as well. Register R1 may not be 0.
0                                   9770     133.              MACRO
                                    9771     134.     &L       LREGA &R1,&R2
                                    9772     135.     &L      $LA    &R1,&R2
                                    9773     136.              C     &R1,=F'14'              Which register set
1GSTINTF  (GSTI00) (09:40) (22MAR04) IHAPSAE  - PSA Extension (ESAME)                                                       Page   20
0Loc    Object Code    Addr1 Addr2  Stmt Lv Lineno    Source Statement           (Hibal 5, Asmedit 3.3)  HLASM R4.0  2004/03/22 09.40
+___    ______ ____    _____ _____  ____ __ ______    ______ _________
0                                   9774     137.              BH    H&SYSNDX
                                    9775     138.              BL    L&SYSNDX
                                    9776     139.              LA    &R1,SIEREG14            Load r14
                                    9777     140.              B     D&SYSNDX
                                    9778     141.     H&SYSNDX LA    &R1,SIEREG15            Load r15
                                    9779     142.              B     D&SYSNDX
                                    9780     143.     L&SYSNDX SLL   &R1,2
                                    9781     144.              LA    &R1,CPCREGS(&R1)        One of the set 0-13
                                    9782     145.     D&SYSNDX LABEL ,
                                    9783     146.              MEND
-                                   9785     148.     *
                                    9786     149.     * GRA -- This macro tranlates a guest real address into an MVS
                                    9787     150.     *        virtual address.
                                    9788     151.     *
                                    9789     152.              MACRO
                                    9790     153.     &L       GRA   &R1,&LOC
                                    9791     154.     &L      $LA    &R1,&LOC                Get the real address
                                    9792     155.              L     RVR,=X'7FFFF000'        Get a page mask
                                    9793     156.              NR    RVR,&R1                 Mask it out
                                    9794     157.              IF    Z,'O &R1,SIEPREFX'      0 -> PREFIX
                                    9795     158.              ELSEIF (RVR,EQ,SIEPREFX),'N &R1,=A(4095)'
                                    9796     159.              A     &R1,CPCORE              Add MVS offset
                                    9797     160.              MEND
1GSTINTF  (GSTI00) (09:40) (22MAR04) IHAPSAE  - PSA Extension (ESAME)                                                       Page   21
0Loc    Object Code    Addr1 Addr2  Stmt Lv Lineno    Source Statement           (Hibal 5, Asmedit 3.3)  HLASM R4.0  2004/03/22 09.40
+___    ______ ____    _____ _____  ____ __ ______    ______ _________
0                                   9799     162.     *
                                    9800     163.     * EXINT -- This macro causes an external interrupt on the CPU
                                    9801     164.     *          whose CPUB is now addressable.
                                    9802     165.     *
0                                   9804     167.              MACRO
                                    9805     168.     &L       EXINT &CODE=,&CPUREG=
                                    9806     169.     .*
                                    9807     170.     .*  CODE   -- The interrupt code to signal.  If this is left blank
                                    9808     171.     .*            then the interrupt code from the SIE data area is
                                    9809     172.     .*            used.  This should go well into a Y type constant.
                                    9810     173.     .*
                                    9811     174.     .*  CPUREG -- Indicates which register contains the CPU address to
                                    9812     175.     .*            store as the signaller.  If this is not specified
                                    9813     176.     .*            then no value is stored.
                                    9814     177.     .*
                                    9815     178.     &L       LABEL ,
                                    9816     179.              L     RS,CPPSALOC             Get the location of page 0
                                    9817     180.              WITH  (PZERO,RS),BEGIN
                                    9818     181.     .*
                                    9819     182.     .* Get us into KEY 0 with the minimum of disturbance
                                    9820     183.     .*
                                    9821     184.              LR    RVR,R2                  R2 must be saved/restored
                                    9822     185.              MODESET EXTKEY=ZERO,SAVEKEY=(2)
                                    9823     186.              LR    EPAR,R2
                                    9824     187.              LR    R2,RVR                  Restore the Register
                                    9825     188.     .*
                                    9826     189.     .* Swap the PSWs
                                    9827     190.     .*
                                    9828     191.              MVC   PZEXOPSW,SIEPSW         Save the OLD PSW
                                    9829     192.              MVC   SIEPSW,PZEXNPSW         Fetch the NEW PSW
                                    9830     193.     .*
                                    9831     194.     .* Put in the interrupt code
                                    9832     195.     .*
                                    9833     196.              AIF   ('&CODE' EQ '').NOCODE
                                    9834     197.              MVC   PZEXIC,=Y(&CODE)        Move in the ICODE
                                    9835     198.              AGO   .CPU
                                    9836     199.     .NOCODE  MVC   PZEXIC,SIEIEXCD         Move in the ICODE
                                    9837     200.     .*
                                    9838     201.     .* Put in the CPU address (if requested)
                                    9839     202.     .*
                                    9840     203.     .CPU     AIF   ('&CPUREG' EQ '').NOCPU
                                    9841     204.              STH   &CPUREG,PZEXCPU         Save the CPU address
                                    9842     205.     .NOCPU   ANOP
                                    9843     206.              MODESET KEYREG=EPAR           Restore the PSW key
                                    9844     207.              END   ,
                                    9845     208.              MEND
1GSTINTF  (GSTI00) (09:40) (22MAR04) IHAPSAE  - PSA Extension (ESAME)                                                       Page   22
0Loc    Object Code    Addr1 Addr2  Stmt Lv Lineno    Source Statement           (Hibal 5, Asmedit 3.3)  HLASM R4.0  2004/03/22 09.40
+___    ______ ____    _____ _____  ____ __ ______    ______ _________
0                                   9847     210.     *
                                    9848     211.     * RSINT -- This sets up for a RESTART interruption for the CPU
                                    9849     212.     *          whose CPUB is now addressable.
                                    9850     213.     *
0                                   9852     215.              MACRO
                                    9853     216.     &L       RSINT
                                    9854     217.     &L       LABEL ,
                                    9855     218.              L     RS,CPPSALOC             Get the location of page 0
                                    9856     219.              WITH  (PZERO,RS),BEGIN
                                    9857     220.     .*
                                    9858     221.     .* Get us into KEY 0 with the minimum of disturbance
                                    9859     222.     .*
                                    9860     223.              LR    RVR,R2                  R2 must be saved/restored
                                    9861     224.              MODESET EXTKEY=ZERO,SAVEKEY=(2)
                                    9862     225.              LR    EPAR,R2
                                    9863     226.              LR    R2,RVR                  Restore the Register
                                    9864     227.     .*
                                    9865     228.     .* Swap the PSWs
                                    9866     229.     .*
                                    9867     230.              MVC   PZRSOPSW,SIEPSW         Save the OLD PSW
                                    9868     231.              MVC   SIEPSW,PZRSNPSW         Fetch the NEW PSW
                                    9869     232.              MODESET KEYREG=EPAR           Restore the PSW key
                                    9870     233.              END   ,
                                    9871     234.              MEND
1GSTINTF  (GSTI00) (09:40) (22MAR04) IHAPSAE  - PSA Extension (ESAME)                                                       Page   23
0Loc    Object Code    Addr1 Addr2  Stmt Lv Lineno    Source Statement           (Hibal 5, Asmedit 3.3)  HLASM R4.0  2004/03/22 09.40
+___    ______ ____    _____ _____  ____ __ ______    ______ _________
0                                   9873     236.     *
                                    9874     237.     * PIINT -- Set up for a PROGRAM interrupt on the CPU whose CPUB is
                                    9875     238.     *          now addressable.
                                    9876     239.     *
0                                   9878     241.              MACRO
                                    9879     242.     &L       PIINT &CODE=,&EXA=,&ILEN=,&BACK=NO
                                    9880     243.     .*
                                    9881     244.     .*  CODE -- Interrupt code.  (REG) should fit in a Y type constant.
                                    9882     245.     .*
                                    9883     246.     .*  EXA  -- Exception Address.  Saved as the translation exception
                                    9884     247.     .*          address.  If it is not specified, no address is saved.
                                    9885     248.     .*
                                    9886     249.     .*  ILEN -- Instruction length code.  2, 4, or 6.  If the EX flag
                                    9887     250.     .*          in the SIE block is on it will be set to 4.
                                    9888     251.     .*
                                    9889     252.     .*  BACK -- Whether to back the PSW up to point at the instruction
                                    9890     253.     .*          Valid values are -- YES: Back it up, and
                                    9891     254.     .*                               NO: Don't back it up.
                                    9892     255.     .*
                                    9893     256.              LCLC  &R
                                    9894     257.     &L       LABEL ,
                                    9895     258.              L     RS,CPPSALOC             Get the location of page 0
                                    9896     259.              WITH  (PZERO,RS),BEGIN
                                    9897     260.     .*
                                    9898     261.     .* Get us into KEY 0 with the minimum of disturbance
                                    9899     262.     .*
                                    9900     263.              LR    RAR,R2                  R2 must be saved/restored
                                    9901     264.              MODESET EXTKEY=ZERO,SAVEKEY=(2)
                                    9902     265.              LR    EPAR,R2
                                    9903     266.              LR    R2,RAR                  Restore the Register
                                    9904     267.     .*
                                    9905     268.     .* Swap the PSWs
                                    9906     269.     .*
                                    9907     270.              MVC   PZPIOPSW,SIEPSW         Save the OLD PSW
                                    9908     271.              MVC   SIEPSW,PZPINPSW         Fetch the NEW PSW
                                    9909     272.     .*
                                    9910     273.     .* Save the interrupt code
                                    9911     274.     .*
                                    9912     275.              AIF   ('&CODE' EQ '').NOCODE  Default ICODE
                                    9913     276.              AIF   ('&CODE'(1,1) EQ '(').REGCODE
                                    9914     277.              MVC   PZPIIC,=Y(&CODE)        Move in the code
                                    9915     278.              AGO   .CODEEND
                                    9916     279.     .REGCODE ANOP
                                    9917     280.     &R       SETC  '&CODE'(2,K'&CODE-2)
                                    9918     281.              STH   &R,PZPIIC               Store the code
                                    9919     282.              AGO   .CODEEND
                                    9920     283.     .NOCODE  ANOP
                                    9921     284.              MVC   PZPIIC,SIEIPRCC         Save code given us
                                    9922     285.     .CODEEND ANOP
                                    9923     286.     .*
                                    9924     287.     .* Move in the exception address
                                    9925     288.     .*
                                    9926     289.              AIF   ('&EXA' EQ '').NOEXA
                                    9927     290.              AIF   ('&EXA'(1,1) EQ '(').REGEXA
                                    9928     291.              MVC   PZTREXA,&EXA            Save the exception address
1GSTINTF  (GSTI00) (09:40) (22MAR04) IHAPSAE  - PSA Extension (ESAME)                                                       Page   24
0Loc    Object Code    Addr1 Addr2  Stmt Lv Lineno    Source Statement           (Hibal 5, Asmedit 3.3)  HLASM R4.0  2004/03/22 09.40
+___    ______ ____    _____ _____  ____ __ ______    ______ _________
0                                   9929     292.              AGO   .NOEXA
                                    9930     293.     .REGEXA  ANOP
                                    9931     294.     &R       SETC  '&EXA'(2,K'&EXA-2)
                                    9932     295.              ST    &R,PZTREXA              Save the exception address
                                    9933     296.     .NOEXA   ANOP
                                    9934     297.     .*
                                    9935     298.     .* Move in the instruction length
                                    9936     299.     .*
                                    9937     300.              AIF   ('&ILEN' EQ '').NOILEN
                                    9938     301.              AIF   ('&ILEN' EQ '4').ILEN4
                                    9939     302.              IF    SIEICEX,'MVC PZPIILC,=Y(4)'
                                    9940     303.              ELSE  'MVC PZPIILC,=Y(&ILEN)'
                                    9941     304.              AGO   .ILCEND
                                    9942     305.     .ILEN4   ANOP
                                    9943     306.              MVC   PZPIILC,=Y(4)
                                    9944     307.              AGO   .ILCEND
                                    9945     308.     .NOILEN  ANOP
                                    9946     309.              MVC   PZPIILC,SIEIPRCL
                                    9947     310.     .ILCEND  ANOP
                                    9948     311.     .*
                                    9949     312.     .* Handle instruction Backup
                                    9950     313.     .*
                                    9951     314.              AIF   ('&BACK' NE 'YES').NOBACK
                                    9952     315.              L     RAR,PZPIOPSW+4
                                    9953     316.              SH    RAR,PZPIILC             Back it up
                                    9954     317.              ST    RAR,PZPIOPSW+4
                                    9955     318.     .NOBACK  ANOP
                                    9956     319.              MODESET KEYREG=EPAR           Restore the PSW key
                                    9957     320.              END   ,
                                    9958     321.              MEND

                                    9966             =*******************************************************************

                                   10115  1          =*
                                   10116  1          =* SIEDATA -- This defines the layout of the information used by the
                                   10117  1          =*            interpretive execution hardware.  Offsets are fixed by
                                   10118  1          =*            the architecture.  This area is 256 bytes long and must
                                   10119  1          =*            be on a 256 byte boundary.
                                   10120  1          =*

0SIEICTL0.SIEICTS  08 ONES         10269  1          =           FLAG  (SIEICTS,X'08')           TS when CC=1

                                   10552     386.     * IOCB -- This control block represents an I/O request from the
                                   10553     387.     *         guest machine.  It is passed as a parm to IOSERV.

 000008                            10566  1  393.     IOCBGSTC   DS    A             Address of the GSTCT
                                   10567  1  394.     *
                                   10568  1  395.     * Information from the Request
                                   10569  1  396.     *
 00000C                            10570  1  397.     IOCBSCH    DS    A             Subchannel ID word

 000018                            10573  1  400.     IOCBCPA    DS    A             Address of the channel program
                                   10574  1  401.     IOCBORB    EQU   IOCBIPRM,*-IOCBIPRM,C'X'          The ORB
 00001C                            10575  1  402.     IOCBSTAT   DS    A             Subchannel status word (from IOSERV)
                                   10576  1  403.     *** SIMULATION CODE ***

                                   10579  1  406.     *** END OF SIMULATION CODE ***

0                                  11839     638.     *******************************************************************
                                   11840     639.     *                                                                 *
                                   11841     640.     *    OMEMGET - This local procedure is called to allocate the     *
                                   11842     641.     *              memory needed for the Orvyl Virtual Machine.  It   *
                                   11843     642.     *              is passed the amount of memory needed and it       *
                                   11844     643.     *              obtains this in multiples of 64K bytes on a 64K    *
                                   11845     644.     *              byte boundary.                                     *
                                   11846     645.     *                                                                 *
                                   11847     646.     *                                                                 *
                                   11848     647.     *      Input - OMEMP dsect                                        *
                                   11849     648.     *                                                                 *
                                   11850     649.     *     Output - none                                               *
                                   11851     650.     *                                                                 *
                                   11852     651.     *                                                                 *
                                   11853     652.     *******************************************************************
-000000                00000 00008 11855     654.     OMEMP    RECORD BEGIN
 000000                            11863  1  655.     OMEMSIZE   DS    F             Size (bytes) of the area needed
 000004                            11864  1  656.     OMEMLOC    DS    A             Location (MVS virtual) of the area
 000008                00008 00008 11865     657.              END   ,
-000334                            11875     659.     OMEMGET  PROC  OMEMP,SCOPE=LOCAL
 000334 D6D4C5D4C7C5E340           11880             +
 00033C 0008/0000                  11881             +
 000340 900F D004/18AF       00004 11883             +
 USING  OMEMGET,R10

 00034C 9680 C000      00000       11900             +
 USING  OMEMP-72,R12
 000350 41D0 C050            00050 11914             +
                                   11915     660.     *
                                   11916     661.     * Get a first try at the memory
                                   11917     662.     *
 000354 5820 C048            00000 11918     663.              L     RA,OMEMSIZE             Get the size wanted
 000358 5420 A5D0            00910 11919     664.              N     RA,=X'FFFF0000'         Round down to 64K mult
 00035C 5020 C048            00000 11920     665.              ST    RA,OMEMSIZE             This is what we're getting
 000360 5A20 A5D4            00914 11921     666.              A     RA,=A(64*1024)          Add the amount for alignment
 USING  @MEMORY-72,R13             11922     667.              POOLGET (RA),TYPE=(LOCAL,PAGE)
 000364 D70B D048 D048 00000 00000 11940             +
 00036A 5020 D04C            00004 11942             +
 00036E 9212 D04A      00002       11952             +
 000372 58F0 A598/0DEF       008D8 11955             +
 000378 1840                       11957     668.              LR    RJ,RVR                  Save the location
                                   11958     669.     *
                                   11959     670.     * Trim the low area to align on 64K boundary
                                   11960     671.     *
 00037A 5A00 A5D8            00918 11961     672.              A     RVR,=A(64*1024-1)
 00037E 5400 A5D0            00910 11962     673.              N     RVR,=X'FFFF0000'        Round off
 000382 5000 C04C            00004 11963     674.              ST    RVR,OMEMLOC             This is where it starts
 000386 1B04                       11964     675.              SR    RVR,RJ                  Amount to trim at the low end
 000388 1830                       11965     676.              LR    RB,RVR                  Save it for later
 00038A 47D0 A066            003A6 11966     677.              IF    POS,BEGIN               If we have
 00038E                            11977  1  678.                POOLFREE (RB),A=(RJ),TYPE=(LOCAL,PAGE)

0                                  12426     805.     *******************************************************************
                                   12427     806.     *                                                                 *
                                   12428     807.     *     PROFINIT - Routine to initialize the guest profiler.  It    *
                                   12429     808.     *                obtains the parameters and if profiling is       *
                                   12430     809.     *                desired it allocates and opens the file.         *
                                   12431     810.     *                                                                 *
                                   12432     811.     *                                                                 *
                                   12433     812.     *      Input - none                                               *
                                   12434     813.     *                                                                 *
                                   12435     814.     *     Output - none                                               *
                                   12436     815.     *                                                                 *
                                   12437     816.     *                                                                 *
                                   12438     817.     *******************************************************************

                                   30515    2327.     *
                                   30516    2328.     * INSTPER -- This is entered if a per occurs on an instruction
                                   30517    2329.     *            that has already completed but causes interception.
                                   30518    2330.     *            This only happens on CS, CDS, and TS instructions
                                   30519    2331.     *            when they can cause interception by setting cc=1.
                                   30520    2332.     *            Since we don't intercept on these instructions, entry
                                   30521    2333.     *            into this section indicates an error.

                                   30540    2340.     * EXTPEND -- This routine is entered when the external interrupt
                                   30541    2341.     *            intervention bit is set in the SIE control block and
                                   30542    2342.     *            the virtual CPU is enabled for external interrupts.
                                   30543    2343.     *            It is the signal that we can now schedule the external
                                   30544    2344.     *            interrupts from other CPU's SIGPs to this CPU.

0                                  31120    2471.     *
                                   31121    2472.     * WAITST -- This routine is entered when the guest machine loads
                                   31122    2473.     *           a wait PSW. It just does a wait.  When posted, it
                                   31123    2474.     *           checks to see whether an external interrupt should
                                   31124    2475.     *           be taken and if so, branches to EXTPEND.
                                   31125    2476.     *

0                                  31307    2502.     *
                                   31308    2503.     * STOPCODE -- This routine is entered when an interception is
                                   31309    2504.     *             caused by a stop intervention bit.  This bit is
                                   31310    2505.     *             used to implement some of the signal processor
                                   31311    2506.     *             orders.  Here we just turn off the bit, and go
                                   31312    2507.     *             to the STOPPED section of the loop where a check
                                   31313    2508.     *             is made for the results of those orders.

0                                  31659    2545.     *******************************************************************
                                   31660    2546.     *                                                                 *
                                   31661    2547.     *       TXIT - Timer exit routine entered from MVS.  It posts the *
                                   31662    2548.     *              corresponding CPUB in case it is waiting,          *
                                   31663    2549.     *              and takes a snapshot of the PSW for profiling.     *

 004400                            32817    2793.     SGEMERS  LABEL ,
 004400 4110 0001            00001 32819    2794.              LA    RS,1                    Get a low order one bit
 004404 5830 7064            00064 32820    2795.              L     RB,CPCPUA               Get the cpu address
 004408 8910 3000            00000 32821    2796.              SLL   RS,@RB                  Shift it into position

                                   32844  1 2798.     *
                                   32845  1 2799.     * Turn on our bit
                                   32846  1 2800.     *
 00440C 5830 2084            00084 32847  1 2801.                L     RB,CPEMERG              Get current bit map
 004410 1431                       32848  1 2802.                NR    RB,RS                   Is it on now?
 004412 4770 A3AC            0458C 32849  1 2803.                IF    NZ,SIGPCC0              If so then we are done
 004416 5830 2084            00084 32863  1 2804.                L     RB,CPEMERG              Get current stuff back
 00441A                            32864  1 2805.                LOOP  BEGIN

 00441C 1641                       32871  2 2807.                  OR    RJ,RS
 00441E BA34 2084            00084 32872  2 2808.                  CS    RB,RJ,CPEMERG           Turn the bit on
 004422 4770 A23A            0441A 32873  1 2809.                UNTIL Z,END                   No matter the interference
                                   32892  1 2810.     *
                                   32893  1 2811.     * Signal the external interruption...
                                   32894  1 2812.     *

 00447A 8810 0004            00004 33056    2843.              SRL   RS,4                    Get R1 field in low spot
 00447E 5410 AE38            05018 33057    2844.              N     RS,=X'0000000E'         Get even reg

                                   33103  1 2854.     *
                                   33104  1 2855.     * First lock out other Set prefix orders
                                   33105  1 2856.     *

                                   33125  1 2860.     *
                                   33126  1 2861.     * Check the state of the addressed CPU
                                   33127  1 2862.     *

 0044C4 47E0 A2F0            044D0 33138  1          +

+___    ______ ____    _____ _____  ____ __ ______    ______ _________
0                                  33260    2908.     *
                                   33261    2909.     * SIGPCC1 -- This stores the status passed in RVR in the guest
                                   33262    2910.     *            register specified by R1 in the SIGP instruction unless
                                   33263    2911.     *            RVR contains 0.  If RVR contains zero then no status is
                                   33264    2912.     *            stored and we go to SIGPCC0 to set a zero condition
                                   33265    2913.     *            code.  If status is stored, we set the condition code
                                   33266    2914.     *            to 1.
0004532 1200/4780 A3AC       0458C 33268    2916.     SIGPCC1  IF    (RVR,Z),SIGPCC0         All zero status
                                   33286    2917.     *
                                   33287    2918.     * Extract the R1 field of the Instruction
                                   33288    2919.     *
 004538 4810 7156            00156 33289    2920.              LH    RS,SIEINST              bits 0-15 of the instruction
 00453C 8810 0004            00004 33290    2921.              SRL   RS,4                    Put R1 field into low end
 004540 5410 AE18            04FF8 33291    2922.              N     RS,=X'0000000F'         Mask it out
 004544 5910 AE1C            04FFC 33292    2923.              LREGA RS,(RS)                 Get the Register address
 004548 4720 A378            04558 33298             +
 00454C 4740 A380            04560 33299             +
 004550 4110 7110            00110 33300             +
 004554 47F0 A388            04568 33301             +
 004558 4110 7114            00114 33302             +
 00455C 47F0 A388            04568 33303             +
 004560 8910 0002            00002 33304             +
 004564 4111 70BC            000BC 33305             +
 004568 5000 1000            00000 33308    2924.              ST    RVR,@RS                 Save the status
 00456C 94CF 711A      0011A       33309    2925.              NI    SIEPSW+2,X'CF'          Clear the CC
 004570 9610 711A      0011A       33310    2926.              OI    SIEPSW+2,X'10'          Then make it 1
 004574 47F0 A3B0            04590 33311    2927.              EXIT  IXSIGP

0                                  33315    2929.     *
                                   33316    2930.     * SIGPCC3 -- This sets the condition code to 3 to indicate that a
                                   33317    2931.     *            not operational CPU was addressed by the SIGP inst.
                                   33318    2932.     *
0004578 9630 711A      0011A       33320    2934.     SIGPCC3  OI    SIEPSW+2,X'30'          Make the CC 3
 00457C 47F0 A3B0            04590 33321    2935.              EXIT  IXSIGP                  All done here
-
                                   33325    2937.     *
                                   33326    2938.     * SIGPCC2 -- This sets the condition code to 2 to indicate that a
                                   33327    2939.     *            busy condition was encountered and that the order could
                                   33328    2940.     *            not be carried out.
                                   33329    2941.     *
0004580 94CF 711A      0011A       33331    2943.     SIGPCC2  NI    SIEPSW+2,X'CF'          Clear the CC
 004584 9620 711A      0011A       33332    2944.              OI    SIEPSW+2,X'20'          Then make it 2
 004588 47F0 A3B0            04590 33333    2945.              EXIT  IXSIGP
-
                                   33337    2947.     *
                                   33338    2948.     * SIGPCC0 -- This sets the condition code to 0 to indicate that the
                                   33339    2949.     *            instruction completed without error and that no status
                                   33340    2950.     *            information was put in the register.
                                   33341    2951.     *
000458C 94CF 711A      0011A       33343    2953.     SIGPCC0  NI    SIEPSW+2,X'CF'          CC zero
0004590 981F C008            00008 33345    2955.              PEND

                                   38662    3838.     *                                                                 *
                                   38663    3839.     *    DTLDBLK - This is a DIAGNOSE service routine.  It reads one  *
                                   38664    3840.     *              block of the currently open kernel into guest real *

0                                  39241    3948.     *******************************************************************
                                   39242    3949.     *                                                                 *
                                   39243    3950.     *     DTPAGE - This is a DIAGNOSE service routine.  It notifies   *
                                   39244    3951.     *              the "machine" that the guest will be using a page  *
                                   39245    3952.     *              frame for paging purposes and that it should be    *
                                   39246    3953.     *              fixed to MVS.  This prevents both MVS and the      *
                                   39247    3954.     *              guest from playing with the storage keys at the    *
                                   39248    3955.     *              same time.  The real address of the frame is       *
                                   39249    3956.     *              passed in r1.                                      *
                                   39250    3957.     *                                                                 *
                                   39251    3958.     *                                                                 *
                                   39252    3959.     *      Input - INTERP dsect                                       *
                                   39253    3960.     *                                                                 *
                                   39254    3961.     *     Output - none                                               *
                                   39255    3962.     *                                                                 *
                                   39256    3963.     *                                                                 *
                                   39257    3964.     *******************************************************************

0                                  39450    3987.     *******************************************************************
                                   39451    3988.     *                                                                 *
                                   39452    3989.     *   DTNOPAGE - This is a DIAGNOSE service routine.  It notifies   *
                                   39453    3990.     *              the "machine" that the page frame whose real       *
                                   39454    3991.     *              address is passed in r1 will not be use by the     *
                                   39455    3992.     *              guest for paging I/O.  This means that it may be   *
                                   39456    3993.     *              unfixed to MVS.  A previous diagnose PAGE should   *
                                   39457    3994.     *              have been done.                                    *
                                   39458    3995.     *                                                                 *
                                   39459    3996.     *                                                                 *
                                   39460    3997.     *      Input - INTERP dsect                                       *
                                   39461    3998.     *                                                                 *
                                   39462    3999.     *     Output - none                                               *
                                   39463    4000.     *                                                                 *
                                   39464    4001.     *                                                                 *
                                   39465    4002.     *******************************************************************

                                   40189    4137.     *                                                                 *
                                   40190    4138.     *   DTMVSRD  - This is a DIAGNOSE service routine.  It moves      *
                                   40191    4139.     *              data from MVS memory to the ORVYL guest.  On       *
                                   40192    4140.     *              entry r1 and r2 are each an even-odd register      *

                                   40197    4145.     *                 r2+1  Protect Key                               *
                                   40198    4146.     *                                                                 *
                                   40199    4147.     *                                                                 *

                                   40201    4149.     *                                                                 *

0                                  40999    4335.     *******************************************************************
                                   41000    4336.     *                                                                 *
                                   41001    4337.     *   DTMVSWR - This is a DIAGNOSE service routine.  It moves,      *
                                   41002    4338.     *             AND's or OR's data from the ORVYL guest to MVS.     *
                                   41003    4339.     *             On entry r1 and r2 are each an even-odd register    *
                                   41004    4340.     *             pair which contain:                                 *
                                   41005    4341.     *                                                                 *
                                   41006    4342.     *                 r1    Orvyl guest virtual address               *
                                   41007    4343.     *                 r1+1  Length of the area                        *
                                   41008    4344.     *                 r2    MVS virtual address                       *
                                   41009    4345.     *                 r2+1  Bits 0-15   Reserved                      *
                                   41010    4346.     *                       Bits 16-23  Option byte                   *
                                   41011    4347.     *                                    0 = MVC data                 *
                                   41012    4348.     *                                    1 = OR data                  *
                                   41013    4349.     *                                    2 = AND data                 *
                                   41014    4350.     *                       Bits 24-31  Protect key                   *
                                   41015    4351.     *                                                                 *
                                   41016    4352.     *                                                                 *
                                   41017    4353.     *      Input - INTERP dsect                                       *
                                   41018    4354.     *                                                                 *
                                   41019    4355.     *     Output - none                                               *
                                   41020    4356.     *                                                                 *
                                   41021    4357.     *                                                                 *
                                   41022    4358.     *******************************************************************
-005E06                            41024    4360.     DTMVSWRT PROC  INTERP,MVWWORK,SCOPE=LOCAL

 AUSING (MVWWORK,INTERP+8)

0                                  41949    4558.     *******************************************************************
                                   41950    4559.     *                                                                 *
                                   41951    4560.     *   DTMVSNM - This is a DIAGNOSE service routine.  It searches    *
                                   41952    4561.     *              LPA and the MVS Nucleus map for a module or        *
                                   41953    4562.     *              csect name.  On entry r1 contains the guest        *
                                   41954    4563.     *              virtual address of the 8 byte name field which     *
                                   41955    4564.     *              must be on a doubleword boundary.  On return r1    *
                                   41956    4565.     *              contains the MVS virtual address if the name was   *
                                   41957    4566.     *              found, otherwise it contains zero.                 *
                                   41958    4567.     *                                                                 *
                                   41959    4568.     *                                                                 *
                                   41960    4569.     *      Input - INTERP dsect                                       *
                                   41961    4570.     *                                                                 *
                                   41962    4571.     *     Output - none                                               *
                                   41963    4572.     *                                                                 *
                                   41964    4573.     *                                                                 *
                                   41965    4574.     *******************************************************************

                                   42563    4681.     *                                                                 *

                                   42565    4683.     *                                                                 *
                                   42566    4684.     *******************************************************************

                                   42576  1 4687.     *
                                   42577  1 4688.     *  Standard Smf header
                                   42578  1 4689.     *
 000000 0700                       42579  1 4690.                CNOP  2,4                 Alignment
 000002                            42580  1 4691.     SMFLEN     DS    AL2                 Total record length
 000004                            42581  1 4692.     SMFSEG     DS    AL2                 Segment descriptor
 000006                            42582  1 4693.     SMFFLG     DS    X                   System indicator
 000007                            42583  1 4694.     SMFTYPE    DS    X                   Smf record no.
 000008                            42584  1 4695.     SMFTIME    DS    A                   Time stamp (in .01 sec)

 000010                            42586  1 4697.     SMFSID     DS    CL4                 System identification

                                   42588  1 4699.     *
                                   42589  1 4700.     *  Data portion - supplied by caller

0                                  42630    4718.     *******************************************************************
                                   42631    4719.     *                                                                 *
                                   42632    4720.     *   DTSMF  - This is a DIAGNOSE service routine.  It writes a     *
                                   42633    4721.     *            record to SMF. On entry r1 contains the guest        *
                                   42634    4722.     *            virtual address of the caller's SMF record area;     *
                                   42635    4723.     *            r2 contains:                                         *
                                   42636    4724.     *                Bits 0-7    SMF record number                    *
                                   42637    4725.     *                Bits 8-15   Reserved                             *
                                   42638    4726.     *                Bits 16-31  Length of the user supplied data     *
                                   42639    4727.     *                                                                 *
                                   42640    4728.     *                                                                 *
                                   42641    4729.     *      Input - INTERP dsect                                       *
                                   42642    4730.     *                                                                 *
                                   42643    4731.     *     Output - CC = 0  Record written                             *
                                   42644    4732.     *                 = 3  Record not written                         *
                                   42645    4733.     *                                                                 *
                                   42646    4734.     *                                                                 *
                                   42647    4735.     *******************************************************************

0                                  43370    4883.     *******************************************************************
                                   43371    4884.     *                                                                 *
                                   43372    4885.     *   DTENQ - This is a DIAGNOSE service routine.  It issues an     *
                                   43373    4886.     *           MVS ENQ or DEQ.  On entry r1 and r2 are each an       *
                                   43374    4887.     *           even-odd register pair which contain:                 *
                                   43375    4888.     *                 r1    Guest virtual address of resource name    *
                                   43376    4889.     *                 r1+1  Length of the resource name               *
                                   43377    4890.     *                 r2    Guest virtual address of queue name       *
                                   43378    4891.     *                 r2+1  Option bits                               *
                                   43379    4892.     *                       Bits  0-29  Reserved                      *
                                   43380    4893.     *                       Bit     30  Exclusive control request     *
                                   43381    4894.     *                       Bit     31  Enqueue request               *
                                   43382    4895.     *                                                                 *
                                   43383    4896.     *                                                                 *
                                   43384    4897.     *      Input - INTERP dsect                                       *
                                   43385    4898.     *                                                                 *
                                   43386    4899.     *     Output - none                                               *
                                   43387    4900.     *                                                                 *
                                   43388    4901.     *                                                                 *
                                   43389    4902.     *******************************************************************
-006540                            43391    4904.     DTENQ    PROC  INTERP,MVEWORK,SCOPE=LOCAL

+___    ______ ____    _____ _____  ____ __ ______    ______ _________
0                                  44319    5072.     *******************************************************************
                                   44320    5073.     *                                                                 *
                                   44321    5074.     *  DTPARM - This is a DIAGNOSE service routine.  It returns the   *
                                   44322    5075.     *           value of a keyword parameter from the init file.      *
                                   44323    5076.     *           On entry r1 and r2 are each an                        *
                                   44324    5077.     *           even-odd register pair which contain:                 *
                                   44325    5078.     *                 r1    Guest virtual address of return area      *
                                   44326    5079.     *                 r1+1  Length of return area (strings must be at *
                                   44327    5080.     *                       least 5 bytes, 4 bytes for VB record RDW  *
                                   44328    5081.     *                       and 1 byte minimum of data area)          *
                                   44329    5082.     *                 r2    Guest virtual address of input parameters *
                                   44330    5083.     *                 r2+1  Length of parameters (fixed length + 8    *
                                   44331    5084.     *                       bytes each keyword, padded with blanks)   *
                                   44332    5085.     *                                                                 *
                                   44333    5086.     *      Input - INTERP dsect                                       *
                                   44334    5087.     *                                                                 *
                                   44335    5088.     *     Output - none                                               *
                                   44336    5089.     *                                                                 *
                                   44337    5090.     *                                                                 *
                                   44338    5091.     *******************************************************************
-000000                00000 00024 44340    5093.     PARWORK  RECORD BEGIN
 000000                            44348  1 5094.     PARILOC    DS    A                       Input parameters - loc
 000004                            44349  1 5095.     PARILEN    DS    A                       | len
 000008                            44350  1 5096.     PAROLOC    DS    A                       Output parameters - loc
 00000C                            44351  1 5097.     PAROLEN    DS    A                       | len
 000010                            44352  1 5098.     PARAREA    DS    A                       Pointer to input/output areas
 000014                            44353  1 5099.     PARIHLOC   DS    A                       Input parameters - Host
 000018                            44354  1 5100.     PAROHLOC   DS    A                       Output parameters - Host
 00001C                            44355  1 5101.     PARR1      DS    A                       Register r1 addr
 000020                            44356  1 5102.     PARR2      DS    A                       Register r2 addr
 000024                00024 00024 44357    5103.              END   ,

+___    ______ ____    _____ _____  ____ __ ______    ______ _________
0                                  45500    5297.     *******************************************************************
                                   45501    5298.     *                                                                 *
                                   45502    5299.     *  DTPARM2- This is a DIAGNOSE service routine.  It returns the   *
                                   45503    5300.     *           value of a keyword parameter from the init file.      *
                                   45504    5301.     *           On entry r1 and r2 are each an                        *
                                   45505    5302.     *           even-odd register pair which contain:                 *
                                   45506    5303.     *                 r1    Guest virtual address of return area      *
                                   45507    5304.     *                 r1+1  Length of return area                     *
                                   45508    5305.     *                 r2    Guest virtual address of input parameters *
                                   45509    5306.     *                 r2+1  Length of parameters (fixed length + 8    *
                                   45510    5307.     *                       bytes each keyword, padded with blanks)   *
                                   45511    5308.     *                                                                 *
                                   45512    5309.     *      Input - INTERP dsect                                       *
                                   45513    5310.     *                                                                 *
                                   45514    5311.     *     Output - none to host                                       *
                                   45515    5312.     *            - guest return area or guest registers set           *
                                   45516    5313.     *                CC = 0 Keyword found, value returned             *
                                   45517    5314.     *                CC > 0 Keyword not found                         *
                                   45518    5315.     *                CC < 0 Keyword found, type mismatch or invalid   *
                                   45519    5316.     *                       type requested                            *
                                   45520    5317.     *                When CC = 0                                      *
                                   45521    5318.     *                  For string type parameters                     *
                                   45522    5319.     *                    r1   Guest pointer to string                 *
                                   45523    5320.     *                    r1+1 Length of string                        *
                                   45524    5321.     *                  For integer type parameters                    *
                                   45525    5322.     *                    r1   Integer value                           *
                                   45526    5323.     *                  For float type parameters                      *
                                   45527    5324.     *                    r1   Short float value                       *
                                   45528    5325.     *                                                                 *
                                   45529    5326.     *                                                                 *
                                   45530    5327.     *******************************************************************
0006CEC                            45532    5329.     DTPARM2  PROC  INTERP,PARWORK,SCOPE=LOCAL
 006CEC C4E3D7C1D9D4F240           45537             +
 006CF4 0008/0028                  45538             +

                                   46754    5542.     *
                                   46755    5543.     *   DTMXREAL - This is the DIAGNOSE "MAXREAL" service routine.
                                   46756    5544.     *
                                   46757    5545.     *              On return:
                                   46758    5546.     *
                                   46759    5547.     *              r1   contains the maximum number of frames which
                                   46760    5548.     *                     the Guest paging routines should long term
                                   46761    5549.     *                     fix.
                                   46762    5550.     *              r1+1 contains the minimum number of frames

                                   46764    5552.     *

0                                  49804    5973.     *******************************************************************
                                   49805    5974.     *                                                                 *
                                   49806    5975.     *   DTWTO  - This is a DIAGNOSE service routine.  It writes a     *
                                   49807    5976.     *            message to the MVS console operator.  On entry r1    *
                                   49808    5977.     *            contains the guest virtual address of the message    *
                                   49809    5978.     *            area, r1+1 contains the length of the message and    *
                                   49810    5979.     *            r2 contains control information as follows:          *
                                   49811    5980.     *                                                                 *
                                   49812    5981.     *                Bits 0-28   Reserved                             *

0                                  51846    6399.     *******************************************************************
                                   51847    6400.     *                                                                 *
                                   51848    6401.     *   DTDPWRIT - This is a DIAGNOSE service routine.  It moves a    *
                                   51849    6402.     *             line of ORVYL guest snap dump output to the host    *
                                   51850    6403.     *             for MVS to pass to the JES writer.                  *
                                   51851    6404.     *                                                                 *
                                   51852    6405.     *             On entry r1 is an even-odd register pair while r2   *
                                   51853    6406.     *             is a register containing the following values:      *
                                   51854    6407.     *                                                                 *
                                   51855    6408.     *                 r1    Orvyl guest virtual address               *
                                   51856    6409.     *                 r1+1  Length of the area                        *
                                   51857    6410.     *                 r2    Token from prior call to DTJSALLO         *
                                   51858    6411.     *                                                                 *
                                   51859    6412.     *                                                                 *
                                   51860    6413.     *      Input - INTERP dsect                                       *
                                   51861    6414.     *                                                                 *
                                   51862    6415.     *     Output - none                                               *
                                   51863    6416.     *                                                                 *
                                   51864    6417.     *                                                                 *
                                   51865    6418.     *******************************************************************
